00034 #ifndef __LWIP_SOCKETS_H__
00035 #define __LWIP_SOCKETS_H__
00036 #include "lwip/ip_addr.h"
00037 
00038 struct sockaddr_in {
00039   u8_t sin_len;
00040   u8_t sin_family;
00041   u16_t sin_port;
00042   struct in_addr sin_addr;
00043   char sin_zero[8];
00044 };
00045 
00046 struct sockaddr {
00047   u8_t sa_len;
00048   u8_t sa_family;
00049   char sa_data[14];
00050 };
00051 
00052 #ifndef socklen_t
00053 #  define socklen_t int
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 
00057 #define SOCK_STREAM     1
00058 #define SOCK_DGRAM      2
00059 #define SOCK_RAW        3
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Option flags per-socket.
00063  */
00064 #define  SO_DEBUG  0x0001    /* turn on debugging info recording */
00065 #define  SO_ACCEPTCONN  0x0002    /* socket has had listen() */
00066 #define  SO_REUSEADDR  0x0004    /* allow local address reuse */
00067 #define  SO_KEEPALIVE  0x0008    /* keep connections alive */
00068 #define  SO_DONTROUTE  0x0010    /* just use interface addresses */
00069 #define  SO_BROADCAST  0x0020    /* permit sending of broadcast msgs */
00070 #define  SO_USELOOPBACK  0x0040    /* bypass hardware when possible */
00071 #define  SO_LINGER  0x0080    /* linger on close if data present */
00072 #define  SO_OOBINLINE  0x0100    /* leave received OOB data in line */
00073 
00074 #define SO_DONTLINGER   (int)(~SO_LINGER)
00075 
00076 /*
00077  * Additional options, not kept in so_options.
00078  */
00079 #define SO_SNDBUF  0x1001    /* send buffer size */
00080 #define SO_RCVBUF  0x1002    /* receive buffer size */
00081 #define SO_SNDLOWAT  0x1003    /* send low-water mark */
00082 #define SO_RCVLOWAT  0x1004    /* receive low-water mark */
00083 #define SO_SNDTIMEO  0x1005    /* send timeout */
00084 #define SO_RCVTIMEO  0x1006    /* receive timeout */
00085 #define  SO_ERROR  0x1007    /* get error status and clear */
00086 #define  SO_TYPE    0x1008    /* get socket type */
00087 
00088 
00089 
00090 /*
00091  * Structure used for manipulating linger option.
00092  */
00093 struct linger {
00094        int l_onoff;                /* option on/off */
00095        int l_linger;               /* linger time */
00096 };
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Level number for (get/set)sockopt() to apply to socket itself.
00100  */
00101 #define  SOL_SOCKET  0xfff    /* options for socket level */
00102

00104 #define AF_UNSPEC       0
00105 #define AF_INET         2
00106 #define PF_INET         AF_INET
00107 #define PF_UNSPEC       AF_UNSPEC
00108 
00109 #define IPPROTO_IP      0
00110 #define IPPROTO_TCP     6
00111 #define IPPROTO_UDP     17
00112 
00113 #define INADDR_ANY      0
00114 #define INADDR_BROADCAST 0xffffffff
00115 
00116 /* Flags we can use with send and recv. */
00117 #define MSG_DONTWAIT    0x40            /* Nonblocking i/o for this operation only */
00118 
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * Commands for ioctlsocket(),  taken from the BSD file fcntl.h.
00122  *
00123  *
00124  * Ioctl's have the command encoded in the lower word,
00125  * and the size of any in or out parameters in the upper
00126  * word.  The high 2 bits of the upper word are used
00127  * to encode the in/out status of the parameter; for now
00128  * we restrict parameters to at most 128 bytes.
00129  */
00130 #if !defined(FIONREAD) || !defined(FIONBIO)
00131 #define IOCPARM_MASK    0x7f            /* parameters must be < 128 bytes */
00132 #define IOC_VOID        0x20000000      /* no parameters */
00133 #define IOC_OUT         0x40000000      /* copy out parameters */
00134 #define IOC_IN          0x80000000      /* copy in parameters */
00135 #define IOC_INOUT       (IOC_IN|IOC_OUT)
00136                                         /* 0x20000000 distinguishes new &
00137                                            old ioctl's */
00138 #define _IO(x,y)        (IOC_VOID|((x)<<8)|(y))
00139 
00140 #define _IOR(x,y,t)     (IOC_OUT|(((long)sizeof(t)&IOCPARM_MASK)<<16)|((x)<<8)|(y))
00141 
00142 #define _IOW(x,y,t)     (IOC_IN|(((long)sizeof(t)&IOCPARM_MASK)<<16)|((x)<<8)|(y))
00143 #endif
00144 
00145 #ifndef FIONREAD
00146 #define FIONREAD    _IOR('f', 127, unsigned long) /* get # bytes to read */
00147 #endif
00148 #ifndef FIONBIO
00149 #define FIONBIO     _IOW('f', 126, unsigned long) /* set/clear non-blocking i/o */
00150 #endif
00151 
00152 /* Socket I/O Controls */
00153 #ifndef SIOCSHIWAT
00154 #define SIOCSHIWAT  _IOW('s',  0, unsigned long)  /* set high watermark */
00155 #define SIOCGHIWAT  _IOR('s',  1, unsigned long)  /* get high watermark */
00156 #define SIOCSLOWAT  _IOW('s',  2, unsigned long)  /* set low watermark */
00157 #define SIOCGLOWAT  _IOR('s',  3, unsigned long)  /* get low watermark */
00158 #define SIOCATMARK  _IOR('s',  7, unsigned long)  /* at oob mark? */
00159 #endif
00160 
00161 #ifndef O_NONBLOCK
00162 #define O_NONBLOCK    04000U
00163 #endif
00164 
00165 #ifndef FD_SET
00166   #undef  FD_SETSIZE
00167   #define FD_SETSIZE    16
00168   #define FD_SET(n, p)  ((p)->fd_bits[(n)/8] |=  (1 << ((n) & 7)))
00169   #define FD_CLR(n, p)  ((p)->fd_bits[(n)/8] &= ~(1 << ((n) & 7)))
00170   #define FD_ISSET(n,p) ((p)->fd_bits[(n)/8] &   (1 << ((n) & 7)))
00171   #define FD_ZERO(p)    memset((void*)(p),0,sizeof(*(p)))
00172 
00173   typedef struct fd_set {
00174           unsigned char fd_bits [(FD_SETSIZE+7)/8];
00175         } fd_set;
00176 
00177   struct timeval {
00178     long    tv_sec;         /* seconds */
00179     long    tv_usec;        /* and microseconds */
00180   };
00181 
00182 #endif
00183 
00184 int lwip_accept(int s, struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t *addrlen);
00185 int lwip_bind(int s, struct sockaddr *name, socklen_t namelen);
00186 int lwip_shutdown(int s, int how);
00187 int lwip_getpeername (int s, struct sockaddr *name, socklen_t *namelen);
00188 int lwip_getsockname (int s, struct sockaddr *name, socklen_t *namelen);
00189 int lwip_getsockopt (int s, int level, int optname, void *optval, socklen_t *optlen);
00190 int lwip_setsockopt (int s, int level, int optname, const void *optval, socklen_t optlen);
00191 int lwip_close(int s);
00192 int lwip_connect(int s, struct sockaddr *name, socklen_t namelen);
00193 int lwip_listen(int s, int backlog);
00194 int lwip_recv(int s, void *mem, int len, unsigned int flags);
00195 int lwip_read(int s, void *mem, int len);
00196 int lwip_recvfrom(int s, void *mem, int len, unsigned int flags,
00197       struct sockaddr *from, socklen_t *fromlen);
00198 int lwip_send(int s, void *dataptr, int size, unsigned int flags);
00199 int lwip_sendto(int s, void *dataptr, int size, unsigned int flags,
00200     struct sockaddr *to, socklen_t tolen);
00201 int lwip_socket(int domain, int type, int protocol);
00202 int lwip_write(int s, void *dataptr, int size);
00203 int lwip_select(int maxfdp1, fd_set *readset, fd_set *writeset, fd_set *exceptset,
00204                 struct timeval *timeout);
00205 int lwip_ioctl(int s, long cmd, void *argp);
00206 
00207 #if LWIP_COMPAT_SOCKETS
00208 #define accept(a,b,c)         lwip_accept(a,b,c)
00209 #define bind(a,b,c)           lwip_bind(a,b,c)
00210 #define shutdown(a,b)         lwip_shutdown(a,b)
00211 #define close(s)              lwip_close(s)
00212 #define connect(a,b,c)        lwip_connect(a,b,c)
00213 #define getsockname(a,b,c)    lwip_getsockname(a,b,c)
00214 #define getpeername(a,b,c)    lwip_getpeername(a,b,c)
00215 #define setsockopt(a,b,c,d,e) lwip_setsockopt(a,b,c,d,e)
00216 #define getsockopt(a,b,c,d,e) lwip_getsockopt(a,b,c,d,e)
00217 #define listen(a,b)           lwip_listen(a,b)
00218 #define recv(a,b,c,d)         lwip_recv(a,b,c,d)
00219 #define read(a,b,c)           lwip_read(a,b,c)
00220 #define recvfrom(a,b,c,d,e,f) lwip_recvfrom(a,b,c,d,e,f)
00221 #define send(a,b,c,d)         lwip_send(a,b,c,d)
00222 #define sendto(a,b,c,d,e,f)   lwip_sendto(a,b,c,d,e,f)
00223 #define socket(a,b,c)         lwip_socket(a,b,c)
00224 #define write(a,b,c)          lwip_write(a,b,c)
00225 #define select(a,b,c,d,e)     lwip_select(a,b,c,d,e)
00226 #define ioctlsocket(a,b,c)    lwip_ioctl(a,b,c)
00227 #endif /* LWIP_COMPAT_SOCKETS */
00228 
00229 #endif /* __LWIP_SOCKETS_H__ */
